info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:20PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SWITZERLAND, CARROLL, NORTHWESTERN OWEN AND WESTERN GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 219 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Dillsboro to near Madison, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Carrollton, Vevay, Warsaw, Florence, Kentucky Speedway, Pleasant, Fairview, Ghent, Sanders, Sparta, Worthville, Prestonville, Center Square, Braytown, Interstate 71 at Mile Marker 52, Langstaff, Wheatley, Locust, Markland and Avonburg. This includes I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 39 and 58. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If these storms become stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...and northern Kentucky. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
